intro: Hypecoum duriaei, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dark seeds. Hypecoum duriaei is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive blooms and drought tolerance.
